result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter NMI Thao was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is to pay mandatory Court costs/fees of $443 + Domestic Abuse Surcharge of $100 for a total of $543.  Payment plan is $100 per month with the first payment due 10-1-2022 and each subsequent payment will be due the 1st of each month thereafter.  Failure to pay will result in a Judgment being entered and collected by WI State Debt Collections
.
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter NMI Thao

Sanford:  correct  /  O'Neil:  yes
Plea Quest & Waiver file d- signed by def / understands
CRT:  Complaint to be amended, the alleged date of offense is May 10, 2022.  Current date of alleged offense is Def b-day
Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY
Sanford:  State is in compliance with Victim Rights act - relies on Complaint for factual basis
CRT finds def's plea is FV&I made - factual basis exists to accept plea - finds def guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Pay mandatory Crt costs/fees of $443 + $100 Dom Abuse Surcharge for total of $543 - payment plan is $100 per month staring w/ 1st pymt due 10-1-2022 & each subsequent payment will be due the 1st of each month until paid in full;  Failure to pay will result in Judgment being entered & collected by the WI State Debt Collectins
